text:
TV Katy Perry's backing dancer steals limelight at Brits Awards for all the wrong reasons after tumbling off stage As the Wide Awake hitmaker performed her new single, Chained to the Rhythm, one unfortunate dancer suffered a painful fall while dressed as a house Share By Ashleigh Rainbird Joshua Taylor 21:53, 22 FEB 2017 Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Katy Perry's backing dancer falls off stage Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Eyes were fixed on Katy Perry 's Brit Awards performance for all the wrong reasons when a backing dancer spectacularly fell off the stage. 
The background performer, dressed as a house, stumbled off the stage as the Wide Awake hitmaker performed her new single, Chained to the Rhythm. 
The blunder was quickly noticed on social media and the unfortunate dancer was dubbed the "new left shark" - a reference to Perry's 2015 Super Bowl performance when a backing dancer dressed as a shark fell spectacularly out of synch . 
Perry also lampooned Theresa May during her Brits performance as the Prime Minister was depicted as a skeleton holding hands with Donald Trump . Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Katy Perry slams Donald Trump and Theresa May at Brits Share this video Watch Next 
The 32-year-old singer - who campaigned for Hillary Clinton during the election - decorated a skeleton as the Republican candidate sporting a red tie, alongside a similar character representing the British Prime Minister. 
The singer says she was inspired to write her comeback material after feeling “depressed” about the outcome of the US election. 
She said: “This was after the election and I was kind of depressed and, you know, I definitely didn’t want to write a club banger. Read More Donald Trump and Theresa May as skeletons during Katy Perry's performance (Photo: PA) Katy Perry and the skeletons during her controversial performance (Photo: PA) Theresa May as a skeleton at the Brits (Photo: AFP) 
“I was like, ‘how are we writing a club banger when the world is on fire?’ It was a nice exercise of like writing a song that at first listen is a really fun song, but I guess the more you dive in to it, it has a different sub-text.” 
She has coined a phrase to describe her new sound as “purposeful pop”. 
But her performance has not gone down well with Tory MPs. 
Referring to the Katy Perry performance, Tory MP Alec Shelbroke said: “This is yet another example of leftie luvvies not being able to accept a democratic outcome. 
“Theresa May is a serious politician for serious times. In an uncertain world, strong links with out major allies are of the utmost importance. 
“The problem with these pop stars os they spend so much time surrounded by their sycophantic luvvie pals that they have no idea what’s actually going on out in the real world.” Like us on Facebook
